description: A beautifully colored parakeet from Australia. There are several species, like the Eastern Rosella, known for their brilliant red heads and multi-colored, scalloped back feathers.
temperament: Visually stunning but are not typically cuddly birds. They are intelligent and active, but prefer not to be handled extensively. Best appreciated for their beauty and playful antics.
loudness: Moderate. They have a pleasant, melodious whistle but can also produce a loud, shrill alarm call when startled.
loudness_icon: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="w-12 h-12 text-yellow-500" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="currentColor" aria-hidden="true" role="img" aria-label="Moderate"><title>Moderate</title><path d="M7 9v6h4l5 5V4l-5 5H7zm9.5 2.5c0 .75-.38 1.41-.97 1.82v-3.64c.59.41.97 1.07.97 1.82zM14 8.25v7.5c1.18-.41 2-1.57 2-2.75s-.82-2.34-2-2.75z"></path></svg>
vocalization: Not known for their talking ability. Their vocalizations are primarily a series of musical whistles and chimes.
dietaryNeeds: A high-quality small parrot seed mix or pellets, supplemented with plenty of fresh vegetables, especially leafy greens. They enjoy foraging.
healthPointers: Can live 15-20 years. Can be prone to fungal infections and intestinal worms, so a clean environment is vital. They are also susceptible to psittacosis.
housing: An aviary or flight cage is ideal as they need plenty of space to fly. Not a great choice for apartment living due to their need for space. Minimum cage size: 36"L x 24"D x 24"H.
